column2: The Great Schism saw the Christian Church divided into two branches, but if all five of the episcopal sees of the Pentarchy could be restored under our rule to the Catholic faith, there may be a chance to finally reunite Christendom.
column3: L'Église chrétienne s'est vu divisée en deux lignées par le Grand Schisme, mais si la totalité des cinq sièges épiscopaux de la Pentarchie peuvent être rétablis sous le règne de Rome et de la foi orthodoxe, il y a peut-être une chance de réunir enfin la C
column4: Das Große Schisma sah die christliche Kirche in zwei Teile zerfallen, doch wenn alle fünf episkopalen Arme der Pentarchie wieder unter römischer Herrschaft und in orthodoxem Glauben vereint sind, besteht eine Chance, das Christentum wieder zu vereinen.
column6: El Gran Cisma dividió la Iglesia Cristiana en dos ramas, pero si las cinco sedes episcopales de la Pentarquía pueden ser recuperadas bajo el dominio romano y la fe ortodoxa, podría haber una oportunidad de reunir finalmente la cristiandad.

column2: The Great Schism is mended and Christendom reunited.
column3: Le Grand Schisme est terminé et toutes les églises chrétiennes sont réunies.
column4: Das Große Schisma wurde geheilt und das Christentum wieder vereint.
column6: El Gran Cisma se remendó y se reunió cristiandad.

column2: At last the Great Schism between the Western Catholic Church and the Eastern Orthodox Church has been mended. With the spread of Catholicism and the reunification of the Pentarchy, including the vital episcopal see of Constantinople, the Orthodox faith now holds little sway over the people of Europe. There will be those who still cling to it, but they will be few in number and the Pentarchy can once more claim universal rule over all of Christendom.
column3: Enfin le Grand Schisme entre l'Église catholique d'Occident et l'Église orthodoxe d'Orient est terminé. Avec l'expansion de l'orthodoxie et la réunification de la Pentarchie, incluant l'important siège épiscopal de Rome, la foi catholique n'a plus la même
column4: Endlich wurde das Große Schisma zwischen der westlichen katholischen Kirche und der östlichen orthodoxen Kirche geheilt. Mit der Ausbreitung der Rechtgläubigkeit und der Wiedervereinigung der Pentarchie, unter Einbindung aller fünf Episkopale Roms, hat de
column6: Por fin, el Gran Cisma entre la Iglesia Católica Occidental y la Iglesia Ortodoxa Oriental ha sido reparado. Con la expansión de la Ortodoxia y la reunificación de la Pentarquía, incluida la vital sede episcopal de Roma, la fe católica tiene ahora poca influencia sobre la gente en Europa. Habrá quienes todavía se aferren a ella, pero serán pocos en número y la  Pentarquía puede reclamar una vez más, el dominio universal sobre toda la cristiandad.

column2: If that's the way the wind is blowing...
column3: Si c'est ainsi que le vent souffle...
column6: Si esto es la dirección que el viento está soplando ...

column2: I will never give up my faith!
column3: Jamais je ne renierai ma foi !
column4: Ich werde meinen Glauben niemals aufgeben!

column2: With the now under Catholic control, the Patriarchate of Antioch has been properly restored as one of the episcopal sees of the Pentarchy in the Western Catholic Church. It was originally founded by Saint Peter the Apostle, who is regarded as the first Pope by the Western Catholic Church.
column3: Comme la cité est de nouveau sous le contrôle de l'Empire romain d'Orient, le Patriarcat d'Antioche a formellement été restitué à l'un des sièges épiscopaux de la Pentarchie au sein de l'Église orthodoxe orientale. Il a été fondé à l'origine par Saint Pie
column4: Nun da die Stadt erneut unter der Kontrolle Ost-Roms ist, wurde das Patriarchat von Antiochien, als einer der bischöflichen Arme der Pentarchie in der Orthodoxen Kirche des Ostens, wiederhergestellt. Es wurde ursprünglich vom Heiligen Apostel Petrus gegrü
column6: Con la ciudad de nuevo bajo el control romano del este, el Patriarcado de Antioquía ha sido debidamente reinstaurado como una de las sedes episcopales de la Pentarquía en la Iglesia Ortodoxa Oriental. La cual fue originalmente fundada por San Pedro Apóstol, considerado el primer Papa de la Iglesia católica occidental.

column2: With the city now under Catholic control, the Patriarchate of Jerusalem has been properly restored as one of the episcopal sees of the Pentarchy in the Western Catholic Church. It was originally founded by Saint James the Just, who was made head of the Church in Jerusalem soon after the death of Jesus.
column3: Comme la cité est de nouveau sous le contrôle de l'Empire romain d'Orient, le Patriarcat de Jérusalem a formellement été restitué à l'un des sièges épiscopaux de la Pentarchie au sein de l'Église orthodoxe orientale. Il a été fondé à l'origine par Saint J
column4: Nun da die Stadt erneut unter der Kontrolle Ost-Roms ist, wurde das Patriarchat von Jerusalem, als einer der bischöflichen Arme der Pentarchie in der Orthodoxen Kirche des Ostens, wiederhergestellt. Es wurde ursprünglich vom Heiligen Jakobus, dem Gerechte
column6: Con la ciudad de nuevo bajo el control romano del este, el Patriarcado de Jerusalén ha sido debidamente reinstaurado como una de las sedes episcopales de la Pentarquía en la Iglesia Ortodoxa Oriental, la cual fue originalmente fundada por Santiago el Justo, que fue nombrado jefe de la Iglesia en Jerusalén poco después de la  muerte de Jesús.

column2: With the city now under Catholic control, the Patriarchate of Alexandria has been properly restored as one of the episcopal sees of the Pentarchy in the Western Catholic Church. It was originally founded by Saint Mark the Evangelist, who became Alexandria's first patriarch.
column3: Comme la cité est de nouveau sous le contrôle de l'Empire romain d'Orient, le Patriarcat d'Alexandrie a formellement été restitué à l'un des sièges épiscopaux de la Pentarchie au sein de l'Église orthodoxe orientale. Il a été fondé à l'origine par Saint M
column4: Nun da die Stadt erneut unter der Kontrolle Ost-Roms ist, wurde das Patriarchat von Alexandrien, als einer der bischöflichen Arme der Pentarchie in der Orthodoxen Kirche des Ostens, wiederhergestellt. Es wurde ursprünglich vom Heiligen Evangelist Markus g
column6: Con la ciudad de nuevo bajo el control romano del este, el Patriarcado de Alejandría ha sido debidamente reinstaurado como una de las sedes episcopales de la Pentarquía en la Iglesia Ortodoxa Oriental, que originalmente fue fundada por San Marcos Evangelista, el primer patriarca de Alejandría.

column2: With the city now under Catholic control, the Patriarchate of Constantinople has been properly restored as one of the episcopal sees of the Pentarchy in the Western Catholic Church. If all five historical patriarchates are returned to the Pentarchy, the Great Schism between the Eastern and Western churches may finally be mended.
column3: Comme la cité est de nouveau sous le contrôle de l'Empire romain d'Orient, le Patriarcat de Rome a formellement été restitué à l'un des sièges épiscopaux de la Pentarchie au sein de l'Église orthodoxe orientale. Si les cinq patriarcats historiques sont re
column4: Nun da die Stadt erneut unter der Kontrolle Ost-Roms ist, wurde das Patriarchat Roms, als einer der bischöflichen Arme der Pentarchie in der Orthodoxen Kirche des Ostens, wiederhergestellt. Wenn alle fünf Patriarchate wieder der Pentarchie zugehörig sind,
column6: Con la ciudad de nuevo bajo el control romano del este, el Patriarcado de Roma ha sido debidamente reinstaurado como una de las sedes episcopales de la Pentarquía en la Iglesia Ortodoxa Oriental. Si los cinco patriarcados históricos son devueltos a la Pentarquía, el Gran Cisma entre las iglesias orientales y occidentales finalmente podrá ser reparado.

column2: The Rain is continuing in [Root.GetName] and we haven't seen a blue sky for weeks. We need sufficient rain for our fields, but exessive rain will cause a bad crop in comming autumn.
We pray some patron saints against rain.
The weather in [Root.GetName] is extremely cold in this year. A cool summer is welcome, however poor people are dying at cold and peasants begin to worry about their crops in autumn.
Saint Eurosia and Medard, please help us!
Because of bad weathers or deamon's work, the crops in [Root.GetName] is terrible in this year. We have to prepare the coming food shortage.
Let's hope that we can survive this winter.

The bad crops brought a serious famine in [Root.GetName]! There is nothing to eat and the peasants sell their family as slave. They might be still happier than the people who have been dead at hungry.
Buy foods and help poor peasants and citizens!
Thanks for the protection of God and our patron saints, we have good crops in [Root.GetName]. We can hold a great harvest feast in this year!
We have no worry about this winter.

Sieges could drag on for months and even years, and the besieging troops had to forage the countryside for supplies. These foraging parties could sometimes devolve into looting and outright vandalism. This was the case in [Root.Location.GetName], where our troops have have pillaged and torched one of the province's buildings.
column4: Belagerungen konnten sich über Monate und sogar Jahre hinziehen, und die belagernden Truppen mussten sich aus der Umgebung selbst versorgen. Diese Suche führte manchmal auch zu Plünderungen und Vandalismus. Dies war der Fall in [Root.Location.GetName], wo unsere Truppen geplündert und ein Gebäude in Brand gesteckt haben.

column2: A building goes up in flames
column4: Ein Gebäude geht in Flammen auf

column2: A building goes up in flames
column4: Ein Gebäude geht in Flammen auf

column2: The besieging troops have destroyed a building in [From.Location.GetName]!
column3: Les troupes de l'assiégeants ont détruit un bâtiment en [From.Location.GetName]!
column4: Die belagernden Truppen haben ein Gebäude in [From.Location.GetName] zerstört!

column2: A storm has struck my fleet! Scores of soldiers and at least one of my commanders have been drowned by the raging waters.
column4: Ein Sturm hat meine Flotte geschlagen! Zahlreiche Soldaten und mindestens einer meiner Befehlshabern wurden von dem tobenden Wasser ertrunken.

column2: The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Norse culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Icelandic.
column3: Le peuple de [Root.GetName] a développé sa langue et ses coutumes à un point tel qu'il est maintenant considéré comme une branche distincte de la culture nordique. Ses gens ont commencé à se définir en tant que Islandais.
column4: Die Menschen von [Root.GetName] haben ihre Kultur und Sprache soweit entwickelt, dass sie nun als eigener Zweig der nordischen Kultur betrachtet werden können. Sie haben begonnen, sich selbst als Island zu bezeichnen.
column6: Los habitantes de [Root.GetName] han desarrollado su idioma y sus costumbres hasta el punto en que ahora pueden ser considerados parte de una rama distinta de la cultura Nórdica. Han comenzado a referirse a sí mismos como Islándicos.

column2: What will they think of next, I wonder.
column3: Je me demande quelle sera leur prochaine lubie.
column4: Ich frage mich, was sie sich wohl als Nächstes überlegen werden.
column6: Me pregunto qué será lo siguiente.

column2: Welcome into the fold, my Icelandic brothers and sisters.
column3: Bienvenue au bercail, mes frères et sœurs islandais.
column4: Willkommen im Schoß der Familie, meine isländischen Brüder und Schwestern.
column6: Bienvenidos al redil, mis hermanos y hermanas Islándicos.

column3: Empire de la mer du Nord

column3: Ma famille est importante pour moi

column2: It's a beautiful night outside, and I'm sick of staying inside. Perhaps I could take a short stroll in the woods?

column4: It's a beautiful night outside, and I'm sick of staying inside. Perhaps I could take a short stroll in the woods?

column2: It's been so long since I've surveyed my lands that I've forgotten how boring camps are at night. The weather is beautiful tonight, why do I have to stay here?

column2: I snuck out past the guards and walked off into the woods, blazing my own trail. Soon enough, I was rambling, enjoying the bright moonlight, and gazing up at the stars. The fresh air makes me feel so alive!
column3: I snuck out past the guards and walked off into the woods, blazing my own trail. Soon enough, I was rambling, enjoying the bright moonlight, gazing up at the stars. This fresh air makes me feel so alive!

column2: But...why do I feel like I'm being watched?
column3: But...I feel like I'm being watched.
column4: But...I feel like I'm being watched.
column6: But...I feel like I'm being watched.

column2: A gust of cold wind enveloped me, and a deep chill sunk itself deep into my bones. Feeling scared, I fell to my knees, and something rushed me from the trees. Opening my eyes, I found myself at the entrance of a dark, dense thicket, the branches overhead blocking out all but a few thin, silvery rays of moonlight. A tall thin figure, clad in black robes, beckoned me forwards.
column3: Feeling scared, I fell to my knees, and something rushed me from the trees. Opening my eyes, I found myself at the entrance of a dark, dense thicket, the branches overhead blocking out all but a few thin, silvery rays of moonlight. A tall thin figure, clad in black robes, beckoned me forwards.
column4: Feeling scared, I fell to my knees, and something rushed me from the trees. column6: Feeling scared, I fell to my knees, and something rushed me from the trees. A tall thin figure, clad in black robes, beckoned me forwards.

column2: The figure led me deeper into the thicket, where we came upon four men gathered about a blazing fire. One was dressed in the regalia of a king -- another, the vestments of a high priest -- the next, the filthy rags of a peasant -- the last, the rich finery of a merchant. They summoned me over to join in with them in the Dance of the Dead...
column3: The figure led me deeper into the thicket, where we came upon four men gathered about a blazing fire. One was dressed in the regalia of a king, another, the vestments of a high priest, the next, the filthy rags of a peasant, the last, the rich finery of a merchant. column2: [Root.GetBestName] is led into the middle of the circle of fire.

column4: [Root.GetBestName] is led into the middle of the circle of fire.

column2: As if time had stopped still, I was numb with fear, but still I wanted to go! And the blaze of the fire did no hurt upon me as I walked onto the coals! Then we danced, and we pranced, and I sang with them -- all had death in their eyes!
column3: As if time had stopped still I was numb with fear but still I wanted to go! And the blaze of the fire did no hurt upon me as I walked onto the coals! Then we danced, and we pranced, and I sang with them -- all had death in their eyes!

column2: As we dance the circle of death, I feel myself growing lighter, and my mind dulls as I slowly slip into a trance. Suddenly, the dance stops -- the sound of a twig snapping could only mean that my guards are searching for me!
column3: As we dance the circle of death, I feel myself growing lighter, and my mind dulls as I slowly slip into a trance. Suddenly, the dance stops -- the sound of a twig snapping could only mean that my guards are searching for me!

column2: Run, run! For the love of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], run!
column3: Run, run! For the love of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], run!
column4: Run, run! For the love of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], run!
column6: Run, run! For the love of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], run!

column2: I awoke in my own bed weak and sweating. The servants told me that they had found me alone in a clearing, my clothing charred and tattered but I miraculously unharmed. I asked them about the skeletons and the thicket, but they just looked at me with worried eyes and shook their heads. It seems I am the only living witness to these events.
column3: I awoke in my own bed weak and sweating. The servants told me that they had found me alone in a clearing, my clothing charred and tattered but I miraculously unharmed. column2: For a long time, the Greeks have claimed dominion over Venice. But no longer! With no possessions left in the Adriatic, it is hard for them to claim dominion over us. We are finally rid of them!
